articles.name: FINAL FANTASY XVI Quest
articles.title: FINAL FANTASY XVI Quest
articles.body:
What this article covers: 

  • Promotion Terms
  • How to Complete the Quest
  • Redemption Instructions
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Promotion Terms

Quest Game: FINAL FANTASY XVI
Quest Name: FFXVI Quest

Offer Details: Play 15 minutes of FINAL FANTASY XVI on PC (full game or demo) to receive a Torgal Puppy avatar decoration. You can learn more about avatar decorations here. 

Who is Eligible: Available to players on PC where both Discord and FINAL FANTASY XVI are available. Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions. 

NOTE: The Torgal Puppy avatar decoration is a limited-time avatar decoration and will only be yours as an avatar decoration until November 23, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). After this date, you will no longer have access to this avatar decoration. 

Availability Period: The FFXVI Quest can be accepted on Discord from September 17, 2024 until September 23, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). 

Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.

Other Terms: Limit of one reward redemption per account.

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center. 

How to Complete the Quest

NOTE: To fulfill the Quest requirement, FINAL FANTASY XVI must be played with your Discord desktop app open simultaneously. 

In order to successfully complete the FFXVI Quest, players who meet the eligibility criteria must play FINAL FANTASY XVI for a minimum duration of 15 minutes.

Redemption Instructions

Once you have completed the Quest by playing 15 minutes of FINAL FANTASY XVI, you’ll be able to claim the Torgal Puppy avatar decoration. The avatar decoration needs to be redeemed by October 23, 2024.

NOTE: If the Quest is not completed by September 23, 2024, the Quest will no longer be available within your Quest Home (Discover > Quests). 

You can use the following methods to claim your Torgal Puppy avatar decoration:

Option 1

1. Head over to the Discover tab by selecting the Discover icon []  at the bottom of the server list on the left side of the app. 

2. This will direct you to the Discover page where you can explore available Discord Quests, by selecting the Quest tab within the Discover list. You can learn more about Discover here.

3. While here, select Claim Reward for the FFXVI Quest. 

Option 2

You can also claim your Torgal Puppy avatar decoration by pressing the Claim Reward button within the Quest bar.  

Learn more about avatar decorations and how to apply them here. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there a limit on how many Quests I can redeem on my Discord account?

A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account. 

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?

A: Some Quests will not be available in all regions based on terms and conditions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.
Additionally, Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions. 

Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?

A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.

Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests. 

A: ​​We encourage you to review Discord’s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests. 

Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?

A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices. 

However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows. 

Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.

Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?

A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in the Quest Home (Discover > Quests) or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.

Q: I am running into issues while trying to make progress with the Epic Games Store version of the game.
A: If you're experiencing problems with the Epic Games Store version of the game, try restarting your Discord desktop client. This often helps resolve progress-related issues.

articles.name: Lofi FAQ
articles.title: Lofi FAQ
articles.body:
What this article covers: 

  • What is Lofi?
  • How to Start Lofi
  • How to Customize Lofi
  • Frequently Asked Questions
Note: This activity is currently only available to a limited number of users.

What is Lofi?

Lofi is an Activity developed by Discord. Vibe with your friends with lofi music and a curated ambience 🎶✨.

How to Start Lofi

At this time, Lofi is available on the Discord desktop app and browser app. There are many different ways you can launch Lofi in Discord for you and your friends! Whether in a server’s voice channel, in a direct message (DM), or a group message, you can check out Activities on Discord for instructions on how to start any Activity. 

Note: Before starting any Discord Activity, please make sure to turn on Hardware Acceleration in User Settings > Advanced.

How to Customize Lofi

1. To change the sound effects and their volumes, look for suggested soundscapes by tapping on the white circles around the scene to increase or decrease the volume of an individual soundscape. Otherwise, tap the slider icon in the media controls for a list of soundscapes to adjust. Changing the soundscapes and their volume will change it for all users in the same Lofi Activity.

2. To adjust the activity volume itself, use the global volume slider in the lower right corner. This will only impact the volume for the person adjusting their volume and not all other listeners in the same Activity.

3. Users can select different scenes using the Scenes button in the UI Menu. Use the left and right buttons to scroll through the options. Changing a scene will change it for all users in the same Lofi Activity.

4. Users can start, pause, or go to the next music track using the media controls at the bottom of the screen. View local time and date by tapping on the clock in the bottom-left corner. If the scene allows, scenes can adjust from day to night using the toggle also in the bottom-left corner. Changing, pausing, and starting the music track will do the same for all players in the same Lofi Activity.

5. Check out the Settings menu for options and other display options in the Lofi Activity. Anything changed in these settings will only be updated for the individual user and not shared by others.

 

Note: If there are multiple participants in the Activity, any changes made by any participant will affect all participants. Only the overall volume level of Lofi and changes made in Settings are personal to each listener.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there an age requirement?

A: There is no age requirement for Lofi.

Q: Where can I view music track information?

A: At this time we do not display the track information.

Q: Can Lofi be enjoyed on mobile?

A: Not at this time. Coming soon!

Q: Where can I report bugs and problems with the game?

A: You'll be able to submit a bug report by going to https://dis.gd/bugreport

For instructions on how bug reports should be submitted, please see our Help Center article: https://dis.gd/bugs 

Q: How do I view/delete my Activities on Discord data? What data is tracked?

A: You can view data for Discord-developed Activities like Lofi through the Discord Privacy and Safety settings. To enhance the gameplay experience, Discord Activities access and temporarily store the following user data once a user joins the Activity:

  • Discord ID
  • Avatar
  • Username

For Activities played in a single session, user data is stored so long as the Activity remains active, even if the user leaves the Activity. Once all users leave the Activity and it is determined the Activity has ended, the user data is deleted and no longer retained.

Note: Deleting your data will remove all of your progression across these Discord-developed activities.

Q: My question isn't listed, what do I do?

A: If all is lost, please submit a ticket to our support team at https://dis.gd/contact

articles.name: Using an Authenticator App on Discord
articles.title: Using an Authenticator App on Discord
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is an Authenticator App?
  • How to Register an Authenticator App 
    • Mobile
    • Desktop/Browser
  • Logging in With an Authenticator App

What is an Authenticator App?

Using an Authenticator App (also called a Time-based One-Time Password or TOTP) is another great way to secure your account by providing a one-time code alongside your password - this ensures that someone can’t log into your account if they only have your password. You can set up an Authenticator App from your Account Settings on the mobile, desktop, and browser app.

How to Register an Authenticator App 

Mobile

1. Tap your avatar in the bottom-right corner and then tap on the cogwheel [] in the top-right corner.

2. Press on Account and then select Enable Authenticator App.

3. To begin this authentication process, you'll need to download either Google Authenticator or Authy on your mobile device.

4. Follow the instructions in the Discord app to copy your secret key into your Authenticator App so it can generate your one-time codes. You’ll be asked to enter one of those codes generated by the Authenticator App to ensure it’s working properly.

5. You can now link your phone number to your Discord account to help act as a backup method for obtaining these authentication codes). This can help you be less worried about losing access to your Authenticator app, but reduces how secure your account is.

6. After enabling an Authenticator App, the Discord app will also have a list of backup codes for login: each of these can be used once instead of a code generated by your Authenticator App, in case you lose access to it. Make sure to download and store these backup codes in a safe, easily accessible place! If you lose these, Discord can’t help you get back into your account.

If you set up your Authenticator App through Authy you can set up a backup by following these steps. If you set it up through Google Authenticator you can back up your account by following these steps.

Desktop/Browser

1. Start by selecting the the cogwheel [] next to your username.

2. This will open your User Settings and take you to the My Account page. While here, you will be able to view the Multi-Factor Authentication options under the Password and Authentication section.

3. Press the Enable Authenticator App button to get started. To begin the authenticator process, you will have to download Google Authenticator app or the Authy app on your mobile device. After you’ve downloaded an Authenticator App, open it on your mobile device and use the camera function to scan the QR code in the Discord app.

4. After scanning the QR code that is displayed in the Discord app, your Authenticator App will generate a 6 digit code. Enter that 6 digit code into “Login with your code” and then tap on Activate.

5. You can now link your phone number to your account to help act as a backup method for obtaining these authentication codes. This can help you be less worried about losing access to your Authenticator App, but reduces how secure your account is.

6. After enabling an Authenticator App, the Discord app will also have a list of backup codes for login: each of these can be used once instead of a code generated by your app, in case you lose access to it. Make sure to download and store these backup codes in a safe, easily accessible place! If you lose these, Discord can’t help you get back into your account.

If you set up your Authenticator App through Authy, you can set up a backup by following these steps. If you set it up through Google Authenticator, you can back up your account by following these steps.

Logging in With an Authenticator App

After enabling an Authenticator App you’ll see an additional prompt to enter an authentication code when you log in to your Discord:

Enter a code from your app or from your list of backup codes, select Confirm, and you’re in!

articles.name: Requesting a Transfer of Server Ownership
articles.title: Requesting a Transfer of Server Ownership
articles.body:
If you’d like to request ownership of a server, please read the information below.

If you’re a server owner and you’d like to transfer ownership of your server, please reference our article on how to transfer server ownership!

What this article covers:

  • What is the policy for Server Ownership Transfers?
  • How do I submit a Server Ownership Transfer Request ticket?
    • What information is needed in a Server Ownership Transfer request?
    • How do I find a Server/User ID?
  • What if my Server is Partnered or Verified?
  • What if I Want to Request an Ownership Transfer of Multiple Servers?
  • Will the Inactive Server Owner be Notified of the Server Transfer?
  • A Note on Data and Your Privacy

What is the policy for Server Ownership Transfers?

Our Discord support team can only assist with server ownership transfers if the following criteria are met:

  • The server has 100 members.
  • The current server owner hasn't accessed their account for at least a month.
  • You (the requestor) have been active on your account in the last 30 days.
  • You (the requestor) have administrator or moderator permissions within the server.
Our Support team can only assist with server ownership transfers if your request meets the criteria. If your request does not meet the criteria, then it will be denied— no exceptions.

How do I submit a Server Ownership Transfer Request ticket?

1. Visit us at https://support.discord.com/hc/requests/new

2. Under What Can We Help You With?, select Help & Support

3. Input the email associated with your Discord account

4. Under Type of Question?, select Server Related Requests

5. Under Server Related Requests, select Server Ownership Transfer Request

6. Input the requested information

What information is needed in a Server Ownership Transfer request?

In order for our support team to review your request, we will need you to submit the following information. Without the information below, we will be unable to proceed further with reviewing this request. If invalid information is provided, your request may be delayed and follow-up will be required.

  • Server Name
  • Server ID
  • Inactive owner's Discord Username
  • Inactive owner's User ID
  • New owner's Discord Username
  • New owner's User ID

How do I find a Server/User ID?

1. You must enable Developer Mode on your Discord app before you can find the server/user ID. You can check out this support article on how you can enable developer mode on your Discord app.

2. After you’ve enabled Developer Mode, you can now find and copy a server ID and a User ID.

To find the user ID, right-click a user’s avatar and then select Copy User ID. You can also press on a user’s avatar > press on the ellipses icon in the top right corner of the user’s profile > select Copy User ID.

To find a server ID, right-click the server’s name or the server icon and then select Copy Server ID.

Please note that we cannot transfer ownership if you’re asking on behalf of another user, and you will need to ask that other user to directly contact our support team with their own transfer request! The new owner should be the one submitting the support ticket, unless your server is Partnered or Verified.

What if my Server is Partnered or Verified?

Before submitting a ticket, please check if your server is part of either the Partnered or Verified programs. If your server is Partnered or Verified, you will have the corresponding badge next to your server’s name. You can learn more about server types on this support article.

Please note that if your server has the Community Feature enabled, then this is not included in the Partner or Verified program. When submitting your transfer request, please only select Yes under Is your server Partnered, Verified? if your server is confirmed to be Partnered or Verified, not Community. Choosing incorrectly could delay your request processing.

After confirming that the server is part of our Partner or Verified program, only the server owner can submit an ownership transfer request.

What if I Want to Request an Ownership Transfer of Multiple Servers?

Our team can only handle one server per request. Therefore, if you want to request ownership of multiple servers, we ask that you file a separate ticket for each one.

Will the Inactive Server Owner be Notified of the Server Transfer?

If a server owner is inactive and not banned, then we do contact them to get their consent for the server ownership transfer. The current server owner has 7 days to respond to our inquiry. If they approve the transfer or they don’t respond within 7 days, we transfer the server if eligible per our requirements. If the current owner denies the transfer request or the criteria for transfer is not met, we will not be able to proceed with the transfer of the server.

A Note on Data and Your Privacy

In line with data minimization principles, information provided by you in your server ownership transfer request will be deleted after the transfer is complete.

We take your privacy and data security seriously. The information collected during the server ownership transfer process, including the server name, server ID, inactive owner's Discord username and user ID, and the new owner's Discord username and user ID, will be used solely for processing your transfer request. This data will be handled confidentially and in accordance with Discord’s Privacy Policy and applicable data protection laws.

articles.name: Honkai: Star Rail Quest
articles.title: Honkai: Star Rail Quest
articles.body:
What this article covers:

  • Promotion Terms
  • How to Complete the Quest
  • Redemption Instructions
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Promotion Terms

Quest Game: Honkai: Star Rail

Quest Name: V2.5 Quest

Offer Details: Stream 15 minutes of Honkai: Star Rail to receive a V2.5 Quest Bundle! This bundle includes the following items:

  • Credit x20,000
  • Lost Gold Fragment ×4
  • Condensed Aether ×5
  • Traveler's Guide ×3

The first 500k users to complete the Quest will also receive Stellar Jade x30.

Who is Eligible: Available on all platforms where the Honkai: Star Rail is available.

Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions.

Availability Period: The V2.5 Quest can be accepted on Discord from September 10, 2024 until September 17, 2024 (11:59PM UTC).

Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward. Reward gift codes expire October 8, 2024 (00:00 UTC +8).

Other Terms: Limit of one reward redemption per account.

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

How to Complete the Quest

Once you have accepted the Quest, you must stream the game through the Discord desktop app and have at least one friend actively watching the stream to complete the Quest requirement.

In order to successfully complete the V2.5 Quest, players who meet the eligibility criteria must live stream their Honkai: Star Rail gameplay to a friend via a Discord voice channel for a minimum duration of 15 minutes on the desktop app.

1. Before you can begin the Quest, launch the game.

2. Then, head to your Discord desktop app and navigate to a direct message (DM), group chat, or a server of your choice.

3. Once there, start a voice call or join a voice channel and select the Screen Share [] icon located in the voice status panel. Be sure to select the individual application for the game before you Go Live.

NOTE: You must select the game application to stream! Streaming your device’s screen will not progress your Quest forward. Once you stream, you can check your progress on the Quest bar or via Quest Home (Discovery > Quests) to ensure progress is being made on the Quest.

4. When you’re ready to stream your gameplay, press Go Live. You can learn more about streaming your game here.

Redemption Instructions

1. Once you have completed the Quest by streaming 15 minutes of Honkai: Star Rail, you will receive a reward code in Quest Home (Discovery > Quests). For detailed instructions on how to claim your reward code, please refer to our Discord Quests FAQ.

Once you select Claim Reward, the reward code will also be sent to the email address associated with your Discord account.

2. Then, visit the official Honkai: Star Rail website's code redemption page and log in to your game account.

3. Enter the redemption code and you'll receive the bundle via in-game mail.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there a limit on how many Quests I can redeem on my Discord account?

A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account.

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?

A: Some Quests will not be available in all regions based on terms and conditions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.

Additionally, Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions. If you are unable to access Quest Home (Discover > Quests), you are not eligible for Quests.

Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?

A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.

Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests.

A: ​​We encourage you to review Discord’s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests.

Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?

A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices.
However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows.

Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.

Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?

A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in Quest Home (Discover > Quests) or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.

articles.name: End-to-End Encryption for Audio and Video
articles.title: End-to-End Encryption for Audio and Video
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • How to Verify that a Call is End-to-End Encrypted
  • How to Verify Participants on a Call
  • Persistent Verification Keys
  • Managing Verified Devices
  • Frequently Asked Questions

End-to-end encryption for audio and video (E2EE A/V) on Discord makes your calls even more private and secure by default. This added layer of security for audio and video calls gives visual confirmation that no one else can listen in on your calls or watch your stream besides the intended participants/viewers.

Note: All audio and video conversations in direct messages (DMs), group messages (GDMs), voice channels, and Go Live streams on Discord will soon be end-to-end encrypted by default.

Below explains how to verify that a call is end-to-end encrypted and how to confirm that the people who you are on a call with are verified too.

Note: Desktop and mobile calls between users with updated clients are end-to-end encrypted without any user action. The features described in this article do not “turn on” end-to-end encryption. We developed these features to show our work and help you confirm that our end-to-end encryption is functioning as intended.

How to Verify That a Call is End-to-End Encrypted

You can verify that your voice call on Discord is end-to-end encrypted by checking the Voice/Video Details of the call.

On the desktop app, open the Voice/Video Details in the bottom left corner of the app to see a new Privacy tab, as well as a green lock icon stating that your call is End-to-end encrypted. 

On the mobile app, you can find that green lock icon while in a voice call by pressing on the voice channel name in the top left corner of the focused voice call view.

The Privacy tab contains the Voice Privacy Code for the call. Privacy codes can be compared with other voice call participants to confirm that everyone in the call sees the same code. Comparing codes should occur out-of-band, for example on a different communication platform.

Note: Privacy codes are long so we split them up into groups of five digits to make them easier to read.

Privacy codes update when participants join or leave calls, so these codes must be compared at the same time with all current call participants in order to verify that the call is end-to-end encrypted.

Each Go Live stream associated with a call also has a Stream Privacy Code that can be accessed via the context menu for the stream, which you can find by right-clicking directly on the Go Live stream and selecting it from the dropdown menu.

By verifying the privacy code for the voice call or for any Go Live stream in the call, you can confirm that all participants have the same encrypted view of the call and that no unexpected participants have joined the call.

How to Verify Participants on a Call

Whether you’re on a call with your best friend, or a group of people in a voice channel on your favorite server, you can choose to verify the identity of the people you’re on a call with for an additional layer of privacy assurance. 

1. Navigate to “View Verification Code”. 

  1. On Desktop, right click on the user in the voice call members list or right click on their tile in the call view and select View Verification Code from the dropdown menu.
  2. On Mobile, open the user's profile either from the call member list or by long pressing on their call tile and then select View Verification Code.

2. You will then see a series of numbers that should match for both you and the person you’re on a call with. 

Note: When you show the Verification Code for another participant, you may see a warning if you have previously verified that participant and the code has changed.

3. Compare the codes out-of-band (via a different communication platform) with the person you’re speaking with.

4. If the codes are a match, then you can select Mark as Verified to confirm that you have successfully verified who you are chatting with. 

Once you’ve verified each person in the call, a small icon will appear next to their name in the call to confirm this action is complete. 

These codes are device-specific and change every time you join a new call with that person by default. With each new call, you will have to repeat the verification process. 

You can opt-in to persistent verification keys to make the verification others perform of your given device permanent. More information on how to do this in the next section.

Note: Verification Codes are long so we split them up into groups of five digits to make them easier to read.

Persistent Verification Keys

To avoid repetitive verification each time you are on a call with the same person, you can enable persistent verification keys. If you have this setting enabled, people you’re speaking with will be able to remember your device and mark it as verified. 

To enable persistent verification keys: 

1. Navigate to User Settings, then select Privacy & Settings. 

2. Select the Encryption tab, and toggle the Enable persistent verification codes

Considerations for setup: 

  • For you to save a persistent verification key for the person you’re speaking with, they’ll need to have the Enable persistent verification codes setting enabled as well.
  • Persistent verification keys are tied to your device, not your user account. This means that if both you and a friend enable this setting, you’ll remain verified to each other every time you join a voice call from those devices.
  • If you log out and back in again on your device, you will lose access to any previously used persistent verification key on that device and others who previously persistently verified your device will see that you are unverified. If you want to use persistent verification keys, you will need to enable the Enable persistent verification codes setting again.

Someone you previously persistently verified may appear unverified when:

  • They’re using a different device than the one you persistently verified
  • They had to log in again on the device you persistently verified
  • Their persistent verification key was removed from local device storage
  • They are being impersonated by someone else

Managing Verified Devices

If you have verified other users with persistent verification codes enabled, you can manage these verified devices in your User Settings.

1. Navigate to User Settings, then select Privacy & Safety. 

2. Select the Encryption tab where you’ll see Verified Devices.

a. On Desktop, select the Encryption tab.

b. On Mobile, select the End-to-end Encryption button on the User Settings tab.

Each user, along with their verified device(s), will be displayed. You can choose to remove the verification for a specific device, identified by the time it was verified, or remove all verifications for a specific user.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How do I know if my call is end-to-end encrypted?

A: You can verify that your call is end-to-end encrypted by checking for the green End-to-end encrypted lock icon in the Voice/Video Details on the desktop app or by pressing on the voice channel name details in the top left corner of the focused call view on mobile.

Q: When will E2EE A/V roll out to Discord web and consoles?

A: Starting September 2024, all updated desktop and mobile Discord clients will support E2EE A/V. Web and consoles will receive E2EE A/V support in 2025.

Q: Why is my call not end-to-end encrypted when I’m on an updated Discord app?

A: Your call may not be end-to-end encrypted because you may be on a call with someone who is not on an updated Discord app. In 2025, all DMs, GDMs, voice channels, and Go Live streams will require updated clients that support end-to-end encryption.

Q: Can I opt out of E2EE A/V?

A: E2EE A/V is enabled by default and cannot be turned off. E2EE A/V currently won’t apply to calls where an unsupported client (i.e., web and consoles) is being used by at least one user. Stage channels also will not be end-to-end encrypted.

Q: Will the preview of my Go Live stream now be private for users not yet in the call?

A: Stream previews – when you are able to see a snippet of an ongoing Go Live stream - are NOT end-to-end encrypted. This means that users not in a call with an ongoing stream may be able to see a preview of the stream. You can disable stream previews forever, or on a per-stream basis.

Q: Can I verify the end-to-end encryption status in Go Live streams?

A: Yes, each Go Live stream has a Stream Privacy Code that can be accessed via the context menu for the stream. You can compare this code out of band with other participants to verify that the stream is end-to-end encrypted.

Q: What happens if I change my device/log into my Discord account on a new device?

A: If you change your device and have persistent verification codes enabled, you will need to go through the verification process again as verification is tied to the specific device. Persistent verification keys must be re-enabled on a new device.

articles.name: Security Keys, Passkeys, and Passwordless Login on Discord
articles.title: Security Keys, Passkeys, and Passwordless Login on Discord
articles.body:
Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA for short) is a great way to add an extra layer of security to your Discord account to help you stay in control of logging in.

What this article covers:
  • How to Register Passkey
    • Mobile
    • Desktop/Browser
  • Passwordless Login with Passkeys
  • How to Use Security Keys

Discord supports the newest standards for authentication: Passkeys and Security Keys, an easier to use and more secure way to sign into your account! Passkeys are encrypted digital keys you create using your fingerprint, face, or screen lock, and they can be stored in a password manager. When you log into Discord, your device will prompt you to identify yourself using a Passkey/Security Key (e.g., with Face ID), and then you’re logged in! No password needed.

All you’ll need to do is Register a Passkey. Once you’ve done that, you’re set! The next time you sign in, you’ll be able to use that passkey for one-step login - see below for more details.

How to Register Passkeys

Mobile

1. Tap your avatar in the bottom-right corner and then tap on the cogwheel [] in the top-right corner. 

2. Tap on Account then select Security Keys. 

3. Tap Add to begin the setup process. You may be asked to confirm your password or complete an MFA challenge, if you already have one enrolled.

4. Your device will prompt you to save the passkey with a password manager. If you want more options on where to save your passkey or want to use an advanced configuration, tap Other Options.

5. Once you finish registering your key, you can choose a name for it. When you’re done, tap Finish.

6. And you’re done! Make sure to download and store your backup codes.

Desktop/Browser

1. Start by selecting the the cogwheel [] next to your username.

2. This will open your User Settings and take you to the My Account page. While here, you will be able to view the Multi-Factor Authentication options under the Password and Authentication section.

3. To set up a Security Key, select Register a Security Key and follow the prompts to reauthenticate.

4. Tap Let’s go to start the Passkey enrollment process. You’ll be prompted by your operating system, if supported, to enroll a Passkey. On MacOS, it looks like this:

 

5. After enrolling MFA, the Discord app will also have a list of backup codes for login: each of these can be used once instead of a code generated by your app, in case you lose access to it. Make sure to download and store these backup codes! If you lose these, Discord can’t help you get back into your account.

And you’re done!

You can now register another Security Key on this device or a different device (you can have up to 16 security keys/passkeys at the same time).

Passwordless Login with Passkeys

Using your passkey to log in is simple! As long as you have a password manager available with a passkey saved in it, you will be prompted to select a passkey. If you’re not getting prompted, you can always tap on Or, sign in with Passkey instead. Your system will prompt you to select the Passkey associated with your account and complete a challenge (e.g., Face ID), then you’re logged in!

How to Use Security Keys

While Security Keys function similarly to passkeys, they generally cannot be used for one-step login on Discord. Fear not! You’ll still be able to use Security Keys as a form of MFA - when you log in, you’ll get an additional challenge after entering your username and password to use you security key:

Press Authenticate with security key to interact with your Security Key, and you’re in!

Passkey Troubleshooting

Having issues with your passkey when trying to log in? Here are some troubleshooting steps to try if your passkey isn’t working for any reason:

First, try using your username and password to log in, then using your Passkey on the following MFA Challenge screen. If that doesn’t work, you’ll need to delete the existing Passkey from both your device and Discord account, then set it up once again. To do this:

1. Make sure you have your Discord backup codes handy just in case. Open your password manager and remove the passkey from your saved credentials for Discord. Refer to your password manager’s documentation for details on how to do this.

2. Use a different MFA method or device to complete the challenge. If you don’t have another set up, you can use a backup code from the list you saved to complete the MFA challenge and finish the login.

3. Go to your Account Settings and repeat the enrollment process to register a new passkey with your password manager. See How to Register Passkeys above for more details, and be sure to remember what you name it!

4. From the Account Settings screen, delete the old passkey associated with your Discord account.

And now you’re starting fresh! Following these steps ensures your remaining saved backup codes continue to work while enrolling a new Passkey.

articles.name: The First Descendant Quest
articles.title: The First Descendant Quest
articles.body:
What this article covers:

  • Promotion Terms
  • How to Complete the Quest
  • Redemption Instructions
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Promotion Terms

Quest Game: The First Descendant
Quest Name: Season 1 Invasion Quest
Offer Details: Play 15 minutes of The First Descendant on PC to receive a Bunny avatar decoration, Albion's speedster. You can learn more about avatar decorations here.
Who is Eligible: Available to players on PC where both Discord and The First Descendant are available.
Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions.

NOTE: The Bunny avatar decoration is a limited-time avatar decoration and will only be yours as an avatar decoration until November 12, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). After this date, you will no longer have access to this avatar decoration.

Availability Period: The Season 1 Invasion Quest can be accepted on Discord from September 6, 2024 until September 12, 2024 (11:59PM UTC).
Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.
Other Terms: Limit of one reward redemption per account.
For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

How to Complete the Quest

Note: To fulfill the Quest requirement, The First Descendant must be played with your Discord app open simultaneously (on browser or desktop).

In order to successfully complete the Season 1 Invasion Quest, players who meet the eligibility criteria must play The First Descendant for a minimum duration of 15 minutes.

Redemption Instructions

Once you have completed the Quest by streaming 15 minutes of The First Descendant, you’ll be able to claim the Bunny avatar decoration. The Bunny avatar decoration needs to be redeemed by October 12, 2024.

Note: If the Quest is not completed by September 12, 2024, the Quest will no longer be available within your Quest Home (Discover > Quests).

You can use the following methods to claim your Bunny avatar decoration:

Option 1

1. Head over to the Discover tab by selecting the Discover icon [] at the bottom of the server list on the left side of the app.

2. This will direct you to the Discover page where you can explore available Discord Quests, by selecting the Quest tab within the Discover list. You can learn more about Discover here.

3. While here, select Claim Reward for the Season 1 Invasion Quest.

Option 2

You can also claim your Bunny avatar decoration by pressing the Claim Reward button within the Quest bar.

Learn more about avatar decorations and how to apply them here.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there a limit on how many Quests I can redeem on my Discord account?

A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account. 

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?

A: Some Quests will not be available in all regions based on terms and conditions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.
Additionally, Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions. 

Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?

A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.

Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests. 

A: ​​We encourage you to review Discord’s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests. 

Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?

A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices. 

However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows. 

Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.

Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?

A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in the Quest Home (Discover > Quests) or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.

Q: When I press on the “Claim Reward” button, it seems to be stuck on a loading loop. 

A: Fear not, you should still see the avatar decoration in your User Settings > Profiles > Change Decorations and be able to use it. Updating your Discord app can also resolve the issue if you're not seeing the reward. 

Q: Can I still claim the Hailey avatar decoration?

A: If you have completed the Season 1 Invasion Quest for the Hailey avatar decoration by September 5, 2024, you have until October 5, 2024 to claim this offer. 

Hailey Avatar Decoration - Enjoy until November 6, 2024 (11:59 UTC)!

articles.name: WEBTOON x Discord Nitro 2024
articles.title: WEBTOON x Discord Nitro 2024
articles.body:
Starting from August 26, 2024 (4PM PST) to September 22, 2024 (11:59PM PST), WEBTOON members can claim 3 months of Discord Nitro. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 3 months of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

We will not be able to refund any leftover membership time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing membership when activating the 3 months Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Requirements: Claim through WEBTOON by September 22, 2024 (11:59PM PST), and redeem in your Discord account by October 21, 2024 (11:59PM PST).

Membership: After the 3 months trial period, your Nitro membership will convert to a monthly recurring membership, and Discord will bill your payment method per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings. 

What this article covers: 

  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is WEBTOON?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my WEBTOON account?  
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 
  • How do I share my Code with a Friend?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Membership Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our membership plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is WEBTOON?

WEBTOON is a global storytelling platform where a vibrant global community of creators and users discover, create and share incredible stories. We pioneered the webcomic format, inspiring a new generation of creators and a cultural movement in visual storytelling. Home to some of the biggest creators, titles, and fandoms in webcomics, WEBTOON empowers anyone to share their story, build a global audience, and make money.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my WEBTOON account?

For more information, you can also follow these steps outlined here.

1. Sign up or log into your WEBTOON’s account through the mobile app.

2. Head to the Coin Shop by tapping on More in the bottom-right corner and then tap on Buy Coins.

3. Subscribe to WEBTOON’s Monthly Coin Premium.

4. Tap on the event banner on the WEBTOON homepage.

5. Input your email and then you should receive the promo code. 

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by October 21, 2024 (11:59PM PST).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro membership on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

NOTE:
- Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Pressing the Promo Link/Copying and Pasting into your Browser Window

  • Start by directly pressing the promotion link or copying and pasting the promotion link into your browser window.

Note: If you're redeeming this Nitro promo link in the Discord Gift Inventory, enter only your unique 24-digit code from the Nitro promotion link in the following format: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX

Step 2 - Logging into Discord

  •  If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Register for a New Account

If you don't have an account, you can directly register a new Discord account

Login to your Account

If you already have a Discord account, you can login to your account using your email and password or using QR code login

Step 3 - Confirming the Correct Account and Payment Method

  • Once you have logged into your Discord account, you'll see a new message asking you to confirm that you are accepting the Nitro subscription on the correct Discord account.
    • You'll see a notice saying: "You are accepting this gift as _________" 
  • If your Discord account does not have your payment information, you'll be asked to fill out your payment details. (Note: You will not be charged until the free trial ends and the subscription renews)
  • When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the "Accept Gift" button. 

Note:

- If you're logged into the incorrect Discord account, press the "Wrong account" button to login to the other account.

Step 4 - Membership Now Activated

After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro membership on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 3 months Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 3 months trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to redeem the Nitro subscription link, you can share this link with a friend to use instead.

After you press on and open the promotion link, you can directly copy the promotion URL link in the new page and send it to a friend. We recommend sending the link in a private direct message. Make sure your friend redeems the code by October 21, 2024 (11:59PM PST).

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Membership Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: WEBTOON members can claim Discord Nitro promo between August 26, 2024 (4PM PST) to September 22, 2024 (11:59PM PST).

After September 22, 2024 (11:59PM PST), WEBTOON users will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by October 21, 2024 (11:59PM PST).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by October 21, 2024 (11:59PM PST), it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 3 of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion from their WEBTOON account?

A: In order to claim the 3 month Nitro, you need to be subscribed to WEBTOON's Monthly plan.

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro membership on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro membership and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost membership? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership,  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 3 months Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 3 months trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Payment Info and Membership Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership plan, at the end of your 3 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro membership at any time before the end of the 3 months.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

Note: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro membership so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 3 months perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been claimed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error when I click on “Next”.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: I’m having trouble with my WEBTOON account.

A: Reach out to WEBTOON’s support team here or to their support email: webtoonsupport@webtoon.com.

articles.name: Discord and Amazon Music Connection FAQ
articles.title: Discord and Amazon Music Connection FAQ
articles.body:
What this article covers: 

  • How to Launch Amazon Music Activity 
  • How to Troubleshoot “Failed to Connect” Error
  • How to Delete an Amazon Music Connection 
    • Via Discord on Desktop
    • Through Amazon’s Website or App

How to Launch Amazon Music Activity

Note: An Amazon account and Amazon Music Unlimited subscription is required to use the Amazon Music Activity.

1. To launch the Amazon Music Activity, navigate to a voice channel or text channel:

  • Via a voice channel: Press the Activity Launcher [] and select the Amazon Music Activity. 

  •  Via a text channel on desktop: Press the App Launcher [] button located right of the chat bar option. Then, select the Amazon Music Activity. 

  • Via text channels on mobile: Press the App Launcher [] button next to the chat bar. Then, select the Amazon Music Activity.

2. Once launched, you will need to provide authorization if you’ve never launched your chosen Activity before.

3. Then, be sure to sign in to your Amazon account or create an account by pressing Sign in. This will redirect you to Amazon via browser. 

4. Once you have successfully connected, close the web browser and return back to the Activity in Discord. 

If you do not have an Amazon Music Unlimited subscription, you will be asked to subscribe. If you have an Amazon Music Unlimited subscription, the Activity should load and you can start listening to music!

How to Troubleshoot “Failed to Connect” Error

If you are running into a “Failed to Connect” error while connecting to the Amazon Music Activity, follow the troubleshooting steps below: 

1. Verify that you have a reliable and strong internet connection. 

2. Ensure that the Amazon account you’re using is not already linked to another Discord account. Each Amazon account can only be connected to one Discord account at a time.

3. In Discord, head into your User Settings > Connections and check if you have previously connected to Amazon Music. 

a. If you are not connected, please retry connecting to Amazon Music. 

b. If you are connected, delete the Amazon Music connection via Discord and Amazon.com by following the steps below. 

4. Make sure your Discord desktop app or mobile app is up-to-date.

5. Force quit the Discord app, and try the steps again.

6. If you continue to experience connection issues, attempt the troubleshooting steps on another platform or device. For example, if you encounter problems on Discord's mobile app, try following the steps using the desktop application. This can help isolate whether the issue is specific to a particular platform or device. 

How to Delete an Amazon Music Connection

Via Discord on Desktop

1. To delete your Amazon Music connection, head into your User Settings by selecting the cogwheel [] in the lower-left corner. 

2. Then, navigate to Connections, where you'll find your Amazon Music connection if you’ve previously linked it. 

3. To delete the connection, select the x button in the upper-right corner of the Activity and Disconnect.

Through Amazon’s Website or App

1. Go to Amazon.com and sign into your Amazon account. 

2. Then, navigate to Account > Manage your data. 

3. Once in Manage your data, select Manage apps & services with data access. If you’ve previously connected to Discord, you will see the Discord app listed. 

4. To delete the connection, press Remove in the Manage Connection column. 

If you have additional questions or encounter any issues with the Activity or Connections, please reach out to our Support team here.

And that’s it! Enjoy sharing and listening to sweet tunes with your friends.

articles.name: Chess.com Diamond for Nitro Members
articles.title: Chess.com Diamond for Nitro Members
articles.body:
Starting from September 4, 2024 (10AM PST) to October 4, 2024 (1PM PST), Discord Nitro members can claim 1 month of Chess.com Diamond. Read more below about the promotion below.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 1 month of Chess.com Diamond for Discord Nitro members

Who is Eligible: To claim through Discord, you must be a current Nitro member. 

Requirements:

Claim through Discord Gift Inventory from September 4, 2024 (10AM PST) to October 4, 2024 (1PM PST), and redeem in your Chess.com account by November 4, 2024 (10AM PST).

After your 1-month free trial period, your Chess.com Diamond subscription will end, and your Chess.com membership will automatically revert to its prior status.

What this article covers: 

  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is Chess.com? 
  • How do I claim Chess.com Diamond in Discord? 
    • Eligibility for Claiming this Promotion in Discord
    • Step By Step Claim Instructions 
  • How do I redeem the Chess.com Diamond via Chess.com? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Chess.com Diamond
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Claiming and Redemption Process
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our subscription plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is Chess.com?

Chess.com is the #1 chess destination with more than 175 million members! Play for free, join tournaments, and improve your game with lessons and videos from top Grandmasters and coaches. Improve your tactics, strategy, analytical thinking and problem solving with training tools and discussion forums.

Unlock all the benefits of the Chess.com Premium Membership and take your chess to the next level. All Premium Plans Include: Endgames, Daily Puzzle Explanations, Video Library, Opening Explorer, Custom Flair, Drills, Time-out Protection for Daily Games, and more.

How do I claim Chess.com Diamond in Discord?

As long as you're a Discord Nitro member, you'll be able to claim the Chess.com Diamond code in the Gift Inventory from September 4, 2024 (10AM PST) to October 4, 2024 (1PM PST).

Eligibility for the Claiming this Promotion in Discord

In order to claim this code, you'll need to be an active member to Discord Nitro, (and you can be either a monthly or yearly Nitro member).

  • If you are an active Discord Nitro member, the code must be claimed in the Gift Inventory by October 4, 2024 (1PM PST).
    • Otherwise, the code will not be available to claim after October 4, 2024 (1PM PST). 

Unfortunately, if you are a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting member, you'll need to subscribe to Nitro in order to claim this promotion.

Step By Step Claim Instructions 

1) Log into Your Discord account and head to the Gift Inventory tab. 

If you’re subscribed to Discord Nitro, start by logging into your Discord account. 

You may notice a notification bar at the top of your browser/desktop app, and you can press the "Take me there" button in the notification bar to be redirected to your Gift Inventory. 

For both the desktop/browser app and mobile app, you can also directly head to your User Settings, and then select Gift Inventory.

2) Click on the Claim button for the Chess.com Diamond Gift

Once you press Claim on the Chess.com Diamond Gift in the Gift Inventory and you'll then see a new pop-up with your 12-character code for this promotion.

If you want to redeem your code later, you can press the Maybe Later button, and then redeem the code before November 4, 2024 (10AM PST).

How do I redeem the Chess.com Diamond Trial via Chess.com?

Once you have claimed the code in the Gift Inventory, you'll now need to officially redeem this code on your Chess.com account.

After claiming the Chess.com Diamond offer in your Gift Inventory by selecting Redeem, you’ll be automatically redirected to Chess.com.

If you’re not logged in, you’ll  be prompted to do so. Once logged in, your account will be instantly credited with the Chess.com Diamond trial.

Eligibility for Redeeming the Chess.com Diamond Trial

This offer is only available for Chess.com members who are not currently subscribed to any Chess.com Premium Plan during the promotional period. 

Offer not available in the following countries: Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, Venezuela, Russia, and Myanmar.

NOTE: If you encounter any issues while trying to redeem this promotion and believe your Chess.com account meets the requirements, contact the Chess.com support team for further review: https://support.chess.com. 

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Claiming and Redemption Process
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion for Nitro members run for?

A: This promotion runs from September 4, 2024 (10AM PST) until October 4, 2024 (1PM PST).

After October 4, 2024 (1PM PST), Nitro members will no longer be able to claim a trial code.

Q: How long does my Chess.com Diamond code last for in my Gift Inventory?

A: Once a code is claimed in the Gift Inventory in Discord, all Chess.com Diamond codes must be redeemed by November 4, 2024 (10AM PST).

If a code has not been redeemed to a Chess.com account by November 4, 2024 (10AM PST), it will expire and you will no longer be able to claim 1 month of Chess.com Diamond.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion in the Discord Gift Inventory?

A: All current and new Nitro members are eligible for this perk. 

This does not include Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boost-only members.

Q: Who can redeem this Chess.com Diamond trial to their Chess.com account?

A: This offer is only available for Chess.com members who are not currently subscribed to any Chess.com Premium Plan during the promotional period. 

Offer not available in the following countries: Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, Venezuela, Russia, and Myanmar. This offer is not allowed to be shared, gifted, or sold.

Q: Can I redeem the Chess.com Diamond promotion to my Chess.com account in my region? 

A: This offer is not available in the following countries: Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, Venezuela, Russia, and Myanmar.

Claiming and Redemption Process

Q: On which Discord platforms can I claim this promotion?

A: You'll be able to claim the promo on the mobile, browser, and desktop version of the Discord app. 

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: What if I don't see the Chess.com Diamond code in my Discord Gift Inventory? 

A: In order to claim this code, you'll need to be an active member to Discord Nitro and you can be either a monthly or yearly Nitro member.

Unfortunately, if you are a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting member, you'll need to subscribe to Nitro in order to claim this promotion.

If you are an active Discord Nitro member, make sure to refresh your Discord client to double check if an update was needed.

  • What if I'm still running into issues? 
    • If the refresh does not work, please submit a ticket through our support system at: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.
    • Be sure to submit the ticket using the email address associated with your Discord account, and send us a screenshot of the following: 
      1. Your My Account tab
      2. Your Gift Inventory tab

Q: I'm having trouble redeeming this promotion on my Chess.com account. How do I contact Chess.com support?

A: If you're experiencing issues, please contact the Chess.com support team directly at https://support.chess.com.

articles.name: 1 Month of Discord Nitro for Chess.com Members
articles.title: 1 Month of Discord Nitro for Chess.com Members
articles.body:
Starting from September 4, 2024 (10AM PST) to October 4, 2024 (1PM PST), Chess.com members who win or draw a game against one of the Discord themed chess bots can claim 1 month of Discord Nitro. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 1 month of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

We will not be able to refund any leftover membership time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing membership when activating the 1 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Chess.com members can claim this promotion from September 4, 2024 (10AM PST) to October 4, 2024 (1PM PST) on all platforms where Chess.com is available. Remember to redeem it in your Discord account by November 3, 2024 (11:59PM PST).

Membership: After the 1 month trial period, your Nitro membership will convert to a monthly recurring membership, and Discord will bill your payment method per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings.

NOTE: Chess.com members must win or draw a game against one of the Discord themed chess bots in order to claim the 1 month of Discord Nitro offer.  

What this article covers: 

  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is Chess.com?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from Chess.com?  
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Membership Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our membership plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is Chess.com?

Chess.com is the #1 chess destination with more than 175 million members! Play for free, join tournaments, and improve your game with lessons and videos from top Grandmasters and coaches. Improve your tactics, strategy, analytical thinking and problem solving with training tools and discussion forums.

Unlock all the benefits of the Chess.com Premium Membership and take your chess to the next level. All Premium Plans Include: Endgames, Daily Puzzle Explanations, Video Library, Opening Explorer, Custom Flair, Drills, Time-out Protection for Daily Games, and more.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from Chess.com?

After winning or drawing a game against one of the Discord themed chess bots, you'll see a Nitro Promo modal. 

NOTE: To claim the Nitro promotion after completing a match with the Discord chess bot, Chess.com members must be logged into their account.
For mobile users, ensure you're using the latest version of the Chess.com app and are logged into your account. If you still encounter issues, try restarting the app or logging out and back in.

Simply press Claim Nitro, and you will be automatically redirected to Discord to finish redeeming the offer. 

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by November 3, 2024 (11:59PM PST).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro membership on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

NOTE:
- Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Logging into Discord

  •  If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Register for a New Account

If you don't have an account, you can directly register a new Discord account

Login to your Account

If you already have a Discord account, you can login to your account using your email and password or using QR code login

Step 2 - Claiming your promotion gift

Once you have logged in to your account, you will see a message asking you to claim your promotion gift. 

The account you are currently logged in as will receive this gift. This gift cannot be shared with a friend and once claimed, the gift cannot be switched to a different user, so be sure you are on the account you want to claim the gift for. If you want to change to a different account, press on the Switch Accounts.

Press on Next when you’re ready to redeem your gift on your chosen account.

Step 3 - Redeeming your promotion gift

Review the details of the promotion then press on Next. Please note: if you switch to a different account at this step, you will not be able to claim and redeem the promotion on the account you switched to. 

Make sure your payment information is accurate. If your Discord account does not have your payment information, please fill out your payment details. You will not be charged until the trial ends and the membership renews.

When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the confirmation button.

Step 4 - Membership Now Activated

After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro membership on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Membership Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details
