Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: Chess.com members can claim Discord Nitro promo between September 4, 2024 (10AM PST) until October 4, 2024 (1PM PST).

After October 4, 2024 (1PM PST), Chess.com players who have won or drawn a game against a Discord themed Chess bot will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by November 3, 2024 (11:59PM PST).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by November 3, 2024 (11:59PM PST), it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 1 month of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion from Chess.com?

A: After winning or drawing a game against one of the Discord themed chess bots, you'll see a Nitro Promo modal. 

NOTE: Chess.com members must be logged into their account to see the modal and claim the Nitro promotion after completing their match with the Discord chess bot.

Simply press Claim Nitro, and you will be automatically redirected to Discord to finish redeeming the offer. 

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro membership on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro membership and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost membership? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership,  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Payment Info and Membership Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership plan, at the end of your 1 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro membership at any time before the end of the 1 month.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

NOTE: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro membership so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 1 month perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been claimed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error when I click on “Next”.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: I'm having trouble redeeming this promotion on my Chess.com account. How do I contact Chess.com support?

A: If you're experiencing issues, please contact the Chess.com support team directly at https://support.chess.com.

articles.name: World of Warcraft Quest
articles.title: World of Warcraft Quest
articles.body:
What this article covers:

  • Promotion Terms
  • How to Complete the Quest
  • Redemption Instructions
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Promotion Terms

Quest Game: World of Warcraft
Quest Name: World of Warcraft: The War Within Quest
Offer Details: Streaming 15 minutes of World of Warcraft and receive a Parrlok Pet.
Who is Eligible: Available to players on PC where both Discord and World of Warcraft are available.
Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions.
Availability Period: The World of Warcraft: The War Within Quest can be accepted on Discord from August 23, 2024 until September 8, 2024 (11:59PM UTC).
Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.
Other Terms:
Limit of one reward redemption per account.
For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

How to Complete the Quest

Once you have accepted the Quest, you must stream the game through the Discord desktop app and have at least one friend actively watching the stream to complete the Quest requirement.

In order to successfully complete the World of Warcraft: The War Within Quest, players who meet the eligibility criteria must live stream their World of Warcraft gameplay to a friend via a Discord voice channel for a minimum duration of 15 minutes on the desktop app. 

1. Before you can begin the Quest, launch the game.

2. Then, head to your Discord desktop app and navigate to a direct message (DM), group chat, or a  server of your choice.

3. Once there, start a voice call or join a voice channel and select the Screen Share [] icon located in the voice status panel. Be sure to select the individual application for the game before you Go Live.

NOTE: You must select the game application to stream! Streaming your device’s screen will not progress your Quest forward. Once you stream, you can check your progress on the Quest bar or via Quest Home (Discovery > Quests) to ensure progress is being made on the Quest.

4. When you’re ready to stream your gameplay, press Go Live. You can learn more about streaming your game here.

Redemption Instructions

1. Once you have completed the Quest by streaming 15 minutes of World of Warcraft, you will receive a gift code in Discovery > Quests. For detailed instructions on how to claim your gift code, please refer to our Discord Quests FAQ.

Once you select Claim Reward, the gift code will also be sent to the email address associated with your Discord account.

2. Then, navigate to the Battle.net desktop app and login into your account.
3. Once logged in, select your profile icon at the top-right corner of the app.
4. While here, press Redeem Code and enter the redemption code to receive the Parrlok Pet via in-game mail.

Note: If the Quest is not completed by September 8, 2024, the Quest will no longer be available within Discovery > Quests.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there a limit on how many Quests I can redeem on my Discord account?

A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account. 

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?

A: Some Quests will not be available in all regions based on terms and conditions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.
Additionally, Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions. 

Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?

A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.

Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests. 

A: ​​We encourage you to review Discord’s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests. 

Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?

A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices. 

However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows. 

Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.

Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?

A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in Discover > Quests or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.

articles.name: ICYMI (In Case You Missed It) FAQs
articles.title: ICYMI (In Case You Missed It) FAQs
articles.body:
Note: This feature is currently experimental. It is only available to a limited number of English, US users and only available on the iOS mobile app.

What this article covers:

  • What is ICYMI?
  • How to edit which Servers or Server Channels appear in your ICYMI
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is ICYMI?

The ICYMI (or In Case You Missed It) tab allows you to catch up on server messages, activities, and more that you might have missed while you weren’t actively using Discord. 

Your ICYMI tab will display the following: Recently played activity from friends, status updates, recent messages or announcements in servers, and more!

How to edit which Servers or Server Channels appear in your ICYMI

If there is a specific server or channel that you want to see more or less of in your ICYMI feed, you can make adjustments through the settings on the ICYMI tab. 

1. While in the ICYMI tab, tap on the filters icon [] in the top-right corner. 

2. Tap on Adjust Server/Channel Recommendations.

3. Pick which server you want to make adjustments for by tapping on it.

4. You can completely remove a server from displaying in ICYMI by toggling Show content in ICYMI, or you can adjust how much information from a server is displayed on ICYMI by selecting one of the following:

  • See Less: You will see less content from this server.
  • Good As Is: With this selected your settings will stay the same.
  • See More!: You will see more content from this server.

5. If you tap on a specific channel, you can edit these settings for each channel, or toggle Show content in ICYMI to completely disable this channel from showing. 

6. You can go through each server and adjust the settings based on your preferences. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Why is my feed empty?

A: When you first access the ICYMI tab, it may take up to 5 minutes for your first feed to generate and it may take 30 minutes for content to be available from all your servers.

Q: Is this feature only available on the mobile app?

A: Yes, ICYMI is only available on the iOS version of our mobile application.

Q: Can I disable ICYMI?

A: Yes. Tap on your avatar in the bottom-right corner. Then tap on the cogwheel [] in the top-right to access User Settings. Press on Advanced and then tap the toggle next to Hide ICYMI tab at the bottom.

articles.name: Ads Policy
articles.title: Ads Policy
articles.body:
Overview

All advertising content is subject to Discord’s community guidelines, however there are additional restrictions for advertising content. 

Discord’s Ads Policy, outlined below, provides guidance to advertisers on the platform to publish trustworthy, safe, useful, and high-quality ads to users. Ads are prohibited, restricted, or allowed based on Discord’s content policies below. 

  • Prohibited: Content you cannot advertise.
  • Restricted: Content you can advertise, with limitations.
  • Allowed: Content you can advertise.

In this policy, you will also find our ads practices and our editorial guidelines for designing and implementing your ad copy and landing page.

This policy is mandatory and applies to all native and third party ads on Discord including ads in Activities. The policy applies to the ad, the landing page, the username, reward, and any other surface directly associated with the ad.

Advertisers on Discord are responsible for their ads ensuring they follow all applicable laws and regulations. In addition to Discord's Ads Policy, advertisers must comply with our Terms of Service, Community Guidelines, and all other policies governing the use of our services.

Ads Content Policy

Below are examples of ads content that is prohibited or restricted on Discord.

Adult Sexual Content

Discord prohibits the promotion of explicit and implicit adult sexual content.

Adult sexual content includes depiction of, or references to:

  • Compensated sexual acts (e.g. escort services, cuddling sites, intimate massage, sex work),
  • Full or partial nudity,
  • Mail-order brides or international marriage brokers,
  • Models in sexualized poses,
  • Non-consensual sexual themes,
  • Penis enlargement or breast enhancement,
  • Pornography, cartoon porn, or hentai,
  • Products in the shape of intimate body parts (e.g. genitals, butts, female breasts),
  • Reproductive, contraceptive, or fertility products,
  • Sex toys and personal lubricants, 
  • Strip and host/hostess clubs,
  • Suggestive live chat or phone calls,
  • Other explicit or implicit suggestive content.

Alcohol Content

Discord prohibits alcohol advertising including branding, online and offline sale, and consumption of alcoholic beverages. 

Alcohol advertising includes:

  • Sale of any type of alcoholic beverage (e.g., beer, wine, or liquor),
  • Events sponsored by alcohol brands,
  • Competitions where alcohol is a prize,
  • Non-alcoholic products offered by alcohol brands,
  • Simulated alcohol games,
  • Depicting people under the influence,
  • Hangover treatments.

Body Alteration

Discord prohibits advertising of body-altering products and services.

Body Alteration includes:

  • Invasive cosmetic procedures (e.g. tongue splitting, ear shaping, waist training),
  • Body piercing,
  • Permanent tattoos,
  • Permanent makeup,
  • UV Skin tanning or skin bleaching products and services.

Charitable Causes

Discord restricts the solicitation of funds for or promotion of charitable causes. Soliciting funds or donations is only allowed for tax-exempt organizations. The ad or ad’s destination must clearly state that donations are tax-exempt, or disclose a charity number or a tax exemption number.

The following are allowed:

  • In the United States, organizations that have 501(c)(3) or 501(c)(4) status,
  • Entities with an equivalent non-profit registration in their home country.

The following are prohibited:

  • Soliciting funds on behalf of a politician, political party, or any other violation of the political content policy,
  • Soliciting funds without tax-exempt status.

Children’s Content 

Discord prohibits advertisements intended solely for children. Children’s content is defined as any content intended for an audience below 13 which is Discord’s minimum age requirement.

Examples of Children's content include:

  • Activities that appeal to children, such as play-acting, simple songs or games, or early education,
  • Actors, characters, celebrities, or toys that appeal to children, including animated characters or cartoon figures.
  • Songs, poems, stories, or other subject matter that reflect an intent to target children.

This policy does not apply to general audience content that could appeal to everyone, but isn’t intended specifically for children, and/or content that is intended for those 13 years or older. 

Dating

Discord prohibits ads for online dating apps or services, matchmaking services, or romance coaching.

Dangerous Activities

Discord prohibits ads that depict or encourage real world dangerous activities.

Dangerous activities create an extreme risk of physical harm to the participant including but not limited to:

  • Physical challenge or stunt trends,
  • Misuse of fireworks.

Drugs and Drugs Paraphernalia

Discord prohibits advertisement of illegal or recreational drugs and paraphernalia.

Drugs and drugs paraphernalia advertising includes but is not limited to:

  • Illegal drugs,
  • Recreational and herbal drugs,
  • CBD products,
  • Accessories associated with drug use and storage (e.g. grinders, syringes, pipes),
  • Drug dispensaries, 
  • Depictions of intoxication or drug use.

Financial Products and Services

Discord prohibits the promotion of financial products and services.

Prohibited financial products and services include but is not limited to:

  • Banking services and institutions,
  • Buy now, pay later (BNPL) providers and payment installment services,
  • Currency exchange, trading, and services,
  • Cryptocurrency and related products
  • Contract for Difference (CFDs),
  • Debt relief and consolidation,
  • Digital wallets,
  • Insurance,
  • Loans products and services,
  • Mobile and electronic payments,
  • Mortgage services,
  • Non-fungible tokens (NFTs) and related products,
  • Securities,
  • Tax preparation or filing.

Gambling Content

Discord prohibits the promotion of gambling or gambling-adjacent activities.

The following are prohibited:

  • Affiliates and websites driving traffic to gambling,
  • Brick-and-mortar casinos,
  • Online casinos and gambling,
  • Odds, tips, picks, forecasts, and handicapping, 
  • Gambling advice and discussions,
  • Games or apps played for money,
  • Horse race betting,
  • Lotteries,
  • Pay to play games of chance with prizes of real-world value,
  • Simulated casinos and their games,
  • Sports betting, sports books, or fantasy sports.

Hateful Content

Discord prohibits ads that promote hateful content.

Hateful content includes degrading, mocking, threatening, attacking or advocating against individuals or protected groups based on, but not limited to:

  • Race,
  • Ethnicity,
  • National origin,
  • Color,
  • Sex,
  • Sexual orientation,
  • Gender identity, 
  • Religious affiliation,
  • Age,
  • Physical or mental disability,
  • Medical or genetic condition,
  • Veteran status,
  • Refugee status,
  • Immigrant Status,
  • Familial status.

Healthcare Content

Discord prohibits advertisement of healthcare products and services. 

Prohibited healthcare products and services include:

  • Clinical trials,
  • Surrogacy services,
  • Telemedicine providers,
  • Online pharmacy,
  • Prescription medicines,
  • Mental health services,
  • Rehabilitation centers,
  • Over the Counter (OTC) medicines, 
  • Health and dietary supplements,
  • Medical devices,
  • Surgical and non surgical cosmetic procedures (e.g. lip fillers, botox, skin lightening creams, plastic surgery). 

Illegal Products and Services

Discord prohibits advertising of illegal products and services, including anything that facilitates or promotes illegal behavior.

Illegal products and services include but is not limited to:

  • Fake IDs, passports, or other official documents,
  • Illegal streaming or downloading of copyrighted material,
  • Instructions for or equipment to illegally access websites, cell phones or software.  

Inappropriate Content

Discord prohibits advertising that contains inappropriate content. 

Categories Discord considers to be inappropriate content include:

  • Distasteful content
    • Content meant to shock or scare,
    • Imagery of guts, gore, sexual fluids, human or animal waste.
  • Offensive and divisive content
  • Sensitive events
    • Content that refers to a sensitive event or topic (e.g. deaths, natural disasters, violent attacks, civil disorder) and contains personal attacks, the selling of goods or services, solicitation of followers, or other attempts to capitalize on these events.
  • Misinformation
    • Content that is false including disinformation, conspiracy theories, and climate change denial.
  • Misleading synthetic or manipulated content
  • Profanity and vulgarity
    • Including obscene uses of symbols, emojis, or gestures.
  • Personal attacks
    • Including the use of non-public personal information in ads.
  • Violence
    • Graphic imagery and realistic displays of crime, violence, physical trauma, execution, 
    • Excessive gore, physical or psychological abuse, self-harm, animal abuse or torture.
  • Malware & Software Downloads
    • The advertising of malware products, including software or devices such as VPN promoting access to geo blocked or illegal services.
    • Malware products include but is not limited to:
      • Spyware,
      • Stalkerware,
      • Illegal hacking devices,
      • Phishing links,
      • Software that is deceptive or compromises user safety.

Intellectual Property

Discord prohibits ads that infringe the copyright, intellectual property, trademark, privacy, or other legal rights of any person or entity.

The following are prohibited:

  • References to Discord and uses of Discord-owned trademark, including suggestions of affiliation with or endorsement by Discord,
  • Ads for products or services primarily used to infringe the intellectual property rights of others,
  • Ads for products or services primarily dedicated to selling counterfeit products,
  • Use of the name, likeness, voice, or other identifying features of an individual without consent,
  • Any use of copyrighted material without written permission.

Political Content

Discord prohibits advertising that contains political content.

Political content includes but is not limited to references to a:

  • Candidate,
  • Political party,
  • Political Action Committees (PACs) or Super PACs,
  • Elected or appointed government official, 
  • Election or referendum, 
  • Ballot measure, proposition, legislation, regulation, or judicial outcome.
  • Advocacy for or against any of the above. 

Tobacco and Tobacco Accessories

Discord prohibits the advertising of tobacco products or accessories. 

Prohibited tobacco products include but are not limited to:

  • Tobacco of any kind,
  • Hookah,
  • Cigars and cigarettes,
  • Cigar bars and hookah lounges,
  • Imitation smoking,
  • Pipes, rolling papers, or filters,
  • E-cigarettes, e-liquid, or vapes.

Unacceptable Business Practices

Discord prohibits unacceptable business models, products, and services.

Categories Discord considers to be unacceptable business practices include but is not limited to:

  • Animal or insect sale,
  • Bail bonds,
  • Counterfeit goods or services, 
  • Homework or essay writing services for students,
  • Extortion and blackmail,
  • Multi-level marketing models or get-rich-quick schemes,
  • Payday loans,
  • Services attempting to change an individual's sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression,
  • Selling social media followers,
  • False, unsubstantiated, unrealistic, or exaggerated claims,
  • Deceptive or misleading ads which withhold reasonable information on pricing, terms or expenses from the landing page. 

Weapons and Weapons Accessories

Discord prohibits the advertising of real-world weapons and weapons accessories.  

Prohibited real-world weapons and weapons accessories include but are not limited to:

  • Knives, throwing stars, daggers, spears, or swords,
  • Guns, firearms, airsoft guns, air guns, blow guns, paintball guns, antique guns, replica guns, imitation guns, or gun parts,
  • Stun guns, taser guns, mace, pepper spray, or other weapons of self defense,
  • Bombs, fireworks, flamethrowers, gunpowder, or explosives,
  • Weapon making instructions,
  • Weapon training programs or classes,
  • Ammunition.

This policy does not apply to ads of virtual reality weapons and weapons accessories for use in video games. 

Weight loss Products and Services

Discord prohibits the advertising of diet and weight loss products and services.

Prohibited diet and weight loss products and services include but are not limited to:

  • Weight loss language or imagery,
  • Diet or weight loss testimonials,
  • Weight loss or appetite suppressant pills or supplements,
  • Before and after weight loss imagery,
  • Procedures such as liposuction, fat burning, or cool sculpting,
  • Encouragement or glamorization of unhealthy or unsafe eating behaviors or eating disorders.

This policy does not apply to ads that promote health, wellness, and fitness products and services that do not focus on weight loss.

Campaign Considerations

Targeting

In order to protect user experience on the platform, advertisers are prohibited from targeting ads to certain audiences or using sensitive categories for such ad targeting. 

Advertisers are prohibited from: 

  • Using copy that asserts or implies knowledge of a user's personally identifiable information. Personally identifiable information (PII) includes any information that could be used to identify an individual, such as a name, home address, social security number, banking information, driver's license number, and any other sensitive data.
  • Targeting users based on any of the following categories: 
    • Alleged or actual commission of a crime 
    • Health 
    • Negative financial status or condition 
    • Marital or relationship status
    • Race, color, or ethnic origin 
    • Religious or philosophical affiliation and/or beliefs 
    • Sexual orientation 
    • Gender identities other than cisgender 
    • Political affiliation and/or beliefs 
    • Trade union membership 
    • Genetic and/or biometric data

In addition to these targeting restrictions, ads for housing or employment are not allowed to target users based on age, sex, gender, or precise location (post code or more precise location). 

Editorial Guidelines

To keep ads trustworthy and useful for Discord users, ads and their landing page must meet our editorial criteria for accuracy and quality. 

Accuracy:

  • Ads must represent the brand or product being advertised.
  • Ads must not be misleading or make exaggerated, sensationalized or inaccurate claims.

Quality:

  • Text must use correct grammar and spelling 
  • Text must avoid excessive punctuation, spaces, or symbols.
  • Images, video, and audio must not be unclear, indecipherable, fuzzy, blurry, extremely grainy, or otherwise of low quality.
  • Imagery with artificial functionality is not permitted (e.g. play or download buttons, notification icons, or elements that mimic Discord features).
  • Images and video must be oriented correctly (not sideways or upside down).

Landing Page:

  • The destination URL must link to a functional landing page.
  • The landing page's primary purpose must not be for advertising and must be relevant to what is being promoted in the ad.
  • The landing page must not contain intrusive pop-up ads, automatic downloads, redirect users to another site, or require users to sign in before they can view the page.
  • The contents of the landing page must comply with all of Discord’s ads content policies.

Sanctions

Advertisements that violate US or other applicable sanctions are prohibited on Discord. 

Additionally, advertisements may not be targeted to individuals located in regions that are subject to general embargoes or comprehensive trade restrictions.

articles.name: Krunker Strike FRVR
articles.title: Krunker Strike FRVR
articles.body:
What this article covers:

  • Promotion Terms
  • How to Complete the Quest
  • Redemption Instructions
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Promotion Terms

Quest Game: Krunker Strike FRVR
Quest Name: Mom, I'm Winning
Offer Details: Win 5 games of Krunker Strike FRVR and receive the Methane Mask.
Who is Eligible: The Quest is available to all Discord users.
Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions. If you are unable to access the Gift Inventory, you are not eligible for this Quest or reward.
Availability Period: The Mom, I'm Winning Quest can be accepted on Discord from August 8, 2024 until August 16, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). The Methane Mask must be redeemed by September 15, 2024.
Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.
Other Terms:
Limit of one reward redemption per account.
For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.
By accepting the Krunker Strike Quest you agree to share some of your Krunker Strike gameplay information with Discord in order to track your Quest progress. This information will be treated in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

How to Complete the Quest

Tap on Start Quest to accept the Mom, I’m Winning Quest, then launch Krunker Strike FRVR as a Discord activity on desktop/browser or mobile to start tracking your 5 wins.

In order to successfully complete the Mom, I'm Winning Quest, players must win 5 games of Krunker Strike FRVR in Discord. If you’re unsure of how to launch an activity in Discord, please check out this Help Center article.

Redemption Instructions

Once you have completed the Quest on Discord by winning 5 games of Krunker Strike FRVR, you’ll be able to claim the Methane Mask. The Methane Mask must be redeemed by September 15, 2024.

Note: If the Quest is not completed by August 16, 2024, the Quest will no longer be available within your Gift Inventory.

You can use the following methods to claim your Methane Mask:
Option 1
After you’ve completed your 5 wins, a pop-up will appear in the game for you to claim the Methane Mask. To claim, tap on Claim and then you can equip it in the game.

Option 2
Head over to your User Settings by selecting the cogwheel [] in the lower left corner.
Then, navigate to your Gift Inventory and select Claim Reward within the Mom, I'm Winning banner.

Option 3
You can also claim your Methane Mask by pressing the Claim Reward button within the Quest bar.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there a limit on how many Quests I can redeem on my Discord account?
A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account.
For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.
Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?
A: Some Quests will not be available in all regions based on terms and conditions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.
Additionally, Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions. If you are unable to access the Gift Inventory, you are not eligible for Quests.
Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?
A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.
Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests.
A: ​​We encourage you to review Discord’s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests.
Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?
A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices.
However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows or MacOS.
Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.
Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?
A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in the Gift Inventory or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.

articles.name: File Attachments FAQ
articles.title: File Attachments FAQ
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is a File Attachment?
  • How to Attach Files
  • File Upload Settings
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile
  • What is NSFW Content Scanning?
  • How to Use Alt Text

What is a File Attachment?

In addition to text messages, users can upload file attachments in Discord to send to others. If you have Nitro, you can upload even bigger files. For non-Nitro subscribers, the maximum file upload is 25MB. 

There is a wide variety of file types that can be uploaded to Discord. Here are the most common examples:

  • JPEG
  • PDF
  • MOV
  • MP4
  • MP3

How to Attach Files

Note: If you upload multiple video files, images, or GIFs in one message, they will be sent together and displayed as a mosaic format.

1. Tap on the plus sign [] located in the text field of the text channel, text chat of a voice channel, or group message that you want to send a file attachment in and then tap on Upload a File.

2. Select the file(s) that you want to attach from your device. You can also write a message to send along with it. 

3. Your file(s) and any text that you included will be sent together in one message.

If you attach non-image files, such as a PDF, DOC, etc.  the files will display as embeds in your message and will not provide a preview of the attached file.

Note: If you want to include Spoiler Tags before sending a file to someone, you can learn how to do that in this Help Center article.

File Upload Settings

There are some settings you can enable to prevent or even minimize the attachments you'll see in Discord.

Desktop/Browser

1. Tap on the cogwheel [] in the bottom-left corner of the app.

2. Navigate to the Chat tab. 

3. A setting is enabled if there’s a checkmark or a setting is disabled if there’s an x.

Here is how each setting works:

  • When posted as links to chat: When an image is posted as a link, the image will be displayed instead of the text link.
  • When uploaded directly to Discord: Any image that is larger than 10MB will be shared as a download instead.
  • With image descriptions: Used for screen readers to describe any shared image.
  • Show embeds and preview website links pasted into the chat: Embeds and website links will display a preview, unless disabled.

Mobile

1. Tap on your profile image in the bottom-right corner.

2. Press on the cogwheel [] in the top-right corner.

3. Navigate to the Chat tab. 

4. On this page, you can enable or disable any setting. If enabled, you’ll see a checkmark. If disabled, you’ll see an x.

5. A lot of the settings on Desktop/Browser are the same for mobile, but let’s go over the mobile-only settings:

  • Save to Device: If you directly send an image or video through your mobile device, the file will be automatically saved to your phone.
  • Video Uploads: In this section, you can manage the quality of videos you upload through Discord. By selecting the "Data Saver" option, your videos will upload more quickly and consume less data.
  • Data Saving Mode: If enabled, images and videos will be sent in lower quality through your cellular network to use less data.

What is NSFW Content Scanning?

"NSFW" or Not Safe For Work (or not suitable for work) is a term to describe inappropriate content that you wouldn't want to look at while in the workplace and is now more widely used to describe content that could be seen as inappropriate for the public.

To help keep users safe, we have both a user and server setting to scan images for NSFW content. If the setting is enabled and the system detects the image could be NSFW, it will block the upload.

You can learn more about these settings in our Safer Messaging on Discord Help Center article.

How to Use Alt Text

Note: ALT text can’t be added to an image if it has already been uploaded.

ALT text - short for alternative text - is a feature that allows users to write an image description to uploads so that anyone using a screen reader can obtain a description of the image without needing to see the actual image itself. 

1. Once you attach the image(s) you want to upload, tap on the pencil icon [] that appears after hovering your cursor over each file.

2. You can change the name of the file and add in the ALT text to describe the image. Press on Save when you’re finished. 

3. You can now send your image(s) with the alt text you’ve written. 

4. If you have the With image descriptions setting enabled and if an image has ALT text, you should see the word ALT on the image. Select ALT and you will then see the ALT text for the image.

If an image has ALT text, you'll be able to see it when you have With image descriptions enabled in your Text & Images settings. If you need a visual aid, pressing ALT this will show the text.

Congratulations! You now have the skills to upload images, send files, and perform other actions through Discord.

articles.name: Discover Tab
articles.title: Discover Tab
articles.body:
Note: This feature is currently experimental and available to only a percentage of users.

What this article covers: 

  • Discover Tab
    • Servers
    • Quests
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Discover Tab

The Discover tab is a central place for finding things to do on Discord. Here, users can discover servers, Quests, and much more. 

To navigate to the Discover tab, select the Discover icon [] at the bottom of the server list on the left side of the app.

This will direct you to the Discover page where you can explore the category pages.

Servers

Servers in Discord are virtual spaces where communities gather to chat, share content, and interact. You can learn more about Server Discovery here.

In the Discover Tab, you will find discoverable Community Servers along with their categories.

To take a closer look at these communities, select the Servers tab within the Discover tab.

Servers are sorted into relevant categories and order of popularity based on the server’s member count.

In Servers, you can browse various server categories like gaming, music, entertainment, and more by selecting from the category bar located at the top of the Servers page.

When you’re ready, press the server you would like to preview! 

Quests

Quests are a way for players to discover games and earn rewards for playing them on Discord. Whether you are playing or streaming your favorite game on Discord, you now have a chance to get rewards!
To explore available Discord Quests, select the Quest tab within the Discover list.

In Quests, you can view recent and current Discord Quests from the last 30 days. While here, press Accept Quest for active Quests to begin.

You can also see past Quests that you’ve completed and earned rewards for by selecting Claimed Quests within the category bar located at the top of the Quest page.

Start a Quest today and enjoy the rewards! You can learn more about Discord Quests here. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Why was my server recently removed from Discover?

A: If your server was recently removed from the Discover tab, it may be due to a violation of Discord’s Discovery Guidelines. Please review the Discord Server Discovery Guidelines and ensure your server complies with them.

articles.name: [Known Issue] Game Overlay
articles.title: [Known Issue] Game Overlay
articles.body:
We have paid attention to user feedback regarding the reliability of Discord’s Game Overlay, which has been known to occasionally cause problems during gameplay. Moreover, it is only supported in a limited number of games due to compatibility challenges inherent to the current implementation.

As a result, on April 15, 2024, Discord started to roll-out a revamped Game Overlay designed to significantly enhance stability, reliability, and performance. The new Game Overlay will not interfere with your game, and is expected to be compatible with nearly all games. This is currently out to 100% of users on the Canary and PTB versions of the Discord app. There is no ETA at this time as to when this will be fully rolled out to all users on the Stable version of Discord.

After this date, you will experience the following changes in Game Overlay behavior:

  • Game Overlay is now enabled by default for all games.
  • Game Overlay will work in windowed fullscreen mode and windowed borderless fullscreen mode, but will not work in true fullscreen mode.
    • True fullscreen mode on desktop means that other computer applications cannot be displayed over the application that’s in true fullscreen mode.
  • Game Overlay will be hidden when the game window is not in focus.
  • Screensharing the game window will not capture the Game Overlay, but screensharing the full screen will still capture the Game Overlay.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What do I do if I always run my game in true fullscreen mode?

A: Most games support borderless fullscreen mode, so you can switch to this mode to continue getting Discord’s Game Overlay in game.

If you need to run the game in true fullscreen mode for any reason, there’s also a global Enable legacy overlay option in User Settings > Game Overlay. Please note that this option may be removed in the future.



Q: Can I keep using the legacy Game Overlay?
A: You can continue using it as long as the option exists in the app, but our goal is to eventually move everyone over to the revamped Game Overlay so they can enjoy a more stable and performant experience.

Q: What if the game I play only works with the legacy Game Overlay?

A: Please first check that you are running borderless fullscreen mode, or sometimes called “windowed” fullscreen mode. The revamped Game Overlay should work in this mode.

If you still experience issues with it, please reach out to our Support team for further assistance.

articles.name: GTA Online Quest
articles.title: GTA Online Quest
articles.body:
What this article covers:

  • Promotion Terms
  • How to Complete the Quest
  • Redemption Instructions
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Promotion Terms

Quest Game: GTA Online
Quest Name: GTA Online Quest
Offer Details: Play 15 minutes of GTA Online and receive The Los Santos avatar decoration. You can learn more about avatar decorations here.
Who is Eligible: Available on PC for US players where GTA Online, GTAV, and Discord are available.
Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions.

Note: The Los Santos avatar decoration is a limited-time avatar decoration and will only be yours as an avatar decoration until October 15, 2024. After this date, you will no longer have access to this avatar decoration.

Availability Period: The GTA Online Quest can be accepted on Discord from August 8, 2024 until August 15, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). The Los Santos avatar decoration needs to be redeemed by September 15, 2024.
Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.
Other Terms:
Limit of one reward redemption per account.
For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

How to Complete the Quest

In order to successfully complete the GTA Online Quest, players who meet the eligibility criteria must play GTA Online or GTAV for a minimum duration of 15 minutes.

Note: To fulfill the Quest requirement, GTA Online or GTAV must be played with your Discord app open simultaneously (on browser or desktop).

Redemption Instructions

Once you have completed the Quest on Discord, by playing 15 minutes of GTA Online or GTAV, you’ll be able to claim the Los Santos avatar decoration. The Los Santos avatar decoration needs to be redeemed by September 15, 2024.

Note: If the Quest is not completed by August 15, 2024, the Quest will no longer be available within Discover > Quests.

You can use the following methods to claim your Los Santos avatar decoration:
Option 1
1.Head over to the Discover tab by selecting the Discover icon [] at the bottom of the server list on the left side of the app.
2.This will direct you to the Discover page where you can explore available Discord Quests, by selecting the Quest tab within the Discover list. You can learn more about Discovery here.
3. While here, select Claim Reward for the GTA Online Quest.

Option 2
You can also claim your Los Santos avatar decoration by pressing the Claim Reward button within the Quest bar.

Learn more about avatar decorations and how to apply them here.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there a limit on how many Quests I can redeem on my Discord account?
A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account.
For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.
Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?
A: Some Quests will not be available in all regions based on terms and conditions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.
Additionally, Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions. 
Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?
A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.
Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests.
A: ​​We encourage you to review Discord’s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests.
Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?
A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices.
However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows or MacOS.
Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.
Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?
A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in the Discover > Quests or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.
